Comment: "Free but not fair" elections.  Elections are considered *free* if there is no directly illegal interference, such as ballot stuffing, voter intimidation, blanket disqualification of specific races or genders to vote, or similar.  Elections are considered *fair* if, in addition, there is no indirect interference which, while not (necessarily) illegal in its own right, combined to skew the playing field and give one side an advantage not related to their merits. Government propaganda, gerrymandering, electoral college inequalities, intentionally restrictive voter registration and hours, etc.  US elections, at least since the *Voting Rights Act of 1965*, are generally considered *free* (there have been accusations by both sides over the years of rigged voting machines, and of course Trump's "fake 2020 election" BS, but none have been corroborated by evidence.) However, the US never had a truly *fair* election system, and furthermore, the fairness has been steadily dropping for decades.
Author: GeneReddit123
